subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] More randomnesses. [1 Attachment]
author: Tim Woolworth
full_text:
When I use my Minibox Pluses and I strictly use a random jump setting on
them because it always gives me startlingly clear communications.  When  I
use the Joe's Box, it is strictly linear and provides the same amount of
communication, just not as clearly.

Do you have any opinions on why you think random works better with your
boxes?

I hear the first two messages. For the message at .11, I could not make out
the first part but the second part sounds like "Fuck the people," not "for
the people."  I did not hear anything in the last one.

Tim

On Thu, Oct 21, 2010 at 2:42 PM, Frank Sumption
<purplealiengirl@...>wrote:

>
>  [Attachment(s) <#12bd01965ee51323_TopText> from Frank Sumption included
> below]
>
>  I send this type of box out and invariably I hear back "that doesn't
> work!" This is single supply random mode, seems to work here! Starts out
> "--be good", at 4 seconds "This is to calm Chris down", at 11 seconds "this
> is recorded for the people", and at the end "the girl is seventeen" --I get
> that alot, and I don't why it is important. "They" claim the "princess" was
> kidnapped, it's the one thing I do remember, and at the same age she was,
> 17,  I actually relived the event, so maybe it's for validation. I don't
> believe in living in the past,  reliving past traumas, or grieving.
>  I don't know, I'm still uncertain if random has an advantage, the messages
> seem longer and in a more natural sounding voice.
>
>  Single supply random takes some finessing to make it work, so I prefer to
> use dual supplies. + and - 12 volts.===more batteries==more $$$ to operate.
>
>  F-S
>
>  
>
